resources.string: The date of this flight, in UTC. If your flight spans across multiple days, enter the date of departure, in UTC.
The date of this simulator flight, in UTC. If your simulator flight spans across multiple days, enter the date at which the simulator flight starts.
The flightnumber of this flight. Not required, will not end up in pdf logbook.
The place of departure. You can enter ICAO and IATA identifiers such as EHGG, GRQ or E25
The place of arrival. You can enter ICAO and IATA identifiers such as EHGG, GRQ or E25
The time of departure, in UTC. You can enter times like 0103, 22:33, or 12 which wil become 00:12Z
The time of arrival, in UTC. If earlier than Time Out, it will be on the next day.
The duration of this simulator session. You can enter times like 0130, 01:30 or 90. Times longer than 99 minutes must be in hours+minutes, eg. 330 or 3:30.

The aircraft used on this flight. You can enter partial registrations such as XO if you mean PH-EXO. It will take the top hit in the drop-down list that will appear after entering 2 letters.\nIf the registration is not known by you or the preloaded aircraft data, you will get a dialog where you can assign a type to this registration.
The type of aircraft of this simulator. For example B733 or FNPT2. This will not be checked against Aircraft Database.
Takeoffs and landings. Enter for example 1 for 1 takeoff/landing, or 2/0 if you did 2 takeoffs and 0 landings.
This field can be used to keep track of things like autolands or landings, if needed for recency. Will not show up in PDF logbook.
Name of the PIC, required by EASA-FCL.
Names of other crew members. Not required.\nYou can enter multiple names, separated by semicolons.
Names of people. Not required, will not end up in PDF logbook.
Remarks. Will end up in PDF logbook.
Select if this is a simulator session.
Select if you want a signature in your pdf logbook.
Select if you want to log this flight as DUAL or INSTRUCTOR.
Select if this was a multi-pilot flight.\nAuto-set from aircraft type if AutoValues is on.
Select if this flight was conducted under IFR.
Select if you are pilot in command or PICUS on this flight. There is no distinction between those in an EASA-FCL logbook.
Select if you were pilot flying on this flight.
If this box is ticked, takeoff/landings, IFR, night and MultiPilot times and whether this flight is logged as copilot will be automatically calculated from other inserted data.
